description: From Ancient Greek λεξικός (lexikós, “of words”), from λέξις (léxis, “a saying, speech, word”), from λέγειν (légein, “to speak”); synchronically, lexico- +‎ -logy.

entries.meaning: (uncountable, linguistics) The part of linguistics that studies words, their nature and meaning, words' elements, relations between words including semantic relations, words groups and the whole lexicon.
examples: The fifth is devoted to doctrine; the sixth and seventh to remarks on syntax and lexicology respectively.

entries.meaning: (countable) A specific theory concerning the lexicon.
